title: Meta – Shop AI glasses and VR headsets | Meta Store
meta_description: Shop the latest AI glasses and wearable technology from Meta. Explore Ray-Ban Meta, Oakley Meta, display glasses and cutting-edge VR headsets.

internal_pages.title: Meta | Social technology company
internal_pages.meta_description: Meta (formerly the Facebook company) builds the future of human connection and the technology that makes it possible. We're moving beyond 2D screens and into immersive experiences, such as virtual and augmented reality, helping create the next evolution of social technology.

internal_pages.title: Company information, culture and principles | About Meta
internal_pages.meta_description: Meta's mission is to build the future of human connection and the technology that makes it possible. Learn more about our culture, employees and leadership team.

h2: Catch up on the latest news

internal_pages.text_sample:
Skip to content
Skip to main content
AI glasses
Meta Quest
Apps and games
Explore Meta
Support

OUR MISSION

Build the future of human connection and the technology that makes it possible

Our principles

Meta is building technology that connects you to people, interests and experiences that matter to you. Our principles embody what we stand for and guide our approach to how we build.

Give people a voice

Build connection and community

Serve everyone

Keep people safe and protect privacy

Promote economic opportunity

Our history

When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way that people connect. Apps such as Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta has moved beyond 2D screens towards immersive experiences in mixed reality and innovation with AI to help build the next evolution in social technology. See how Meta has grown over time:

2004
2005
2006
2007
2008
2009
2010
2011
2012
2013
2014
2015
2016
2017
2018
2019
2020
2021
2022
2023
2024
2025

4 FEBRUARY 2004

Mark Zuckerberg and co-founders Dustin Moskovitz, Chris Hughes and Eduardo Saverin launch Facebook.

1 JUNE 2004

Facebook moves to Palo Alto, California.

1 SEPTEMBER 2004

Launch of the Facebook wall, giving people a place to post messages to their friends.

1 DECEMBER 2004

1 million people are now active on Facebook.

20 SEPTEMBER 2005

thefacebook.com officially drops the "the" and becomes Facebook.

1 OCTOBER 2005

Launch of Facebook photos.

1 APRIL 2006

Facebook for mobile launches.

1 AUGUST 2006

First version of the Facebook API is introduced.

5 SEPTEMBER 2006

Launch of News Feed.

26 SEPTEMBER 2006

Facebook expands registration so that anyone can join.

24 MAY 2007

Facebook platform launches.

22 JUNE 2007

Facebook Video launches.

6 NOVEMBER 2007

Facebook launches self-service ads platform and Pages.

6 APRIL 2008

Facebook chat launches.

9 MAY 2008

Facebook Connect is announced.

10 JULY 2008

Facebook for iPhone launches.

21 JULY 2008

New Facebook launches.

9 FEBRUARY 2009

Introduction of the Like button.

11 MARCH 2009

New Facebook home page launches.

21 JULY 2010

500 million people are now active on Facebook.

18 AUGUST 2010

Launch of Facebook Places.

6 OCTOBER 2010

New groups are introduced.

5 DECEMBER 2010

Launch of the new profile.

15 APRIL 2011

Opening of our first, custom-built data centre in Prineville, Oregon.

9 AUGUST 2011

Messenger is introduced.

22 SEPTEMBER 2011

Timeline is introduced at f8.

9 APRIL 2012

Instagram acquisition is announced.

18 MAY 2012

Facebook holds its initial public offering.

4 OCTOBER 2012

More than 1 billion people are active on Facebook.

26 FEBRUARY 2013

More than 100 million people use Instagram every month.

20 JUNE 2013

Video on Instagram launches.

20 AUGUST 2013

Internet.org is announced.

12 DECEMBER 2013

Instagram Direct launches.

15 DECEMBER 2013

Donate launches

19 FEBRUARY 2014

WhatsApp acquisition is announced.

17 MARCH 2014

Connectivi
